title: How Many Calories in 20 Grapes?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 20 grapes, including carbs, sugars, fiber, protein, fat, and easy tweaks for your snack.
assumptions: Fresh, seedless red or green grapes, average size (~5 g each), with skin; 20 grapes ≈ 100 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, size, ripeness, and growing conditions. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 20 grapes provide about 69 kcal, mostly from natural sugars, with 0.7 g protein and 0.9 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp honey drizzle over 20 grapes

faqs.q: How many calories in one grape?

faqs.a: Yes, 20 grapes have ~16 g natural sugars, but also fiber to slow absorption.

faqs.q: Do grapes have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal—0.7 g protein and 0.2 g fat in 20 grapes.

faqs.q: How does grape variety affect calories?
faqs.a: Red and green grapes are similar (~69 kcal per 100 g); darker varieties may have slightly more antioxidants but same calories.

faqs.q: Are these values for seedless or seeded grapes?
faqs.a: Seedless assumed; seeded may add negligible calories from seeds.
